SEARCH
Package org.newsclub.net.unix

Class SocketTestBase<A extends SocketAddress>

java.lang.Object
org.newsclub.net.unix.SocketTestBase<A>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractNamespaceTest, AcceptTimeoutTest, AFTIPCTopologyWatcherTest, AFVSOCKExtensionsTest, AncillaryMessageTest, AvailableTest, BufferOverflowTest, CancelAcceptTest, DatagramSocketTest, EndOfFileTest, FileDescriptorsTest, FinalizeTest, InetAddressTest, PeerCredentialsTest, ReadWriteTest, SelectorTest, ServerSocketCloseTest, ServerSocketTest, SocketAddressTest, SocketChannelTest, SocketFactoryTest, SocketOptionsTest, SocketPairTest, SocketTest, SoTimeoutTest, StandardSocketOptionsTest, TcpNoDelayTest, ThroughputTest, UnixDomainSocketAddressTest
public abstract class SocketTestBase<A extends SocketAddress> extends Object
Some base functionality for socket tests. This class provides access to the AddressSpecifics methods for the socket implementation under test. It is essential to use these wrapper methods in tests instead of directly calling the AFSocket etc. methods: Some socket implementations (and sometimes only in certain kernel/environment configurations) may expose unexpected behavior that is otherwise hard to catch. This is especially relevant when connecting/binding sockets (see connectSocket(Socket, SocketAddress), #bindServerSocket(ServerSocket, SocketAddress)}, etc.)
Author:
Christian Kohlschuetter

    • shouldDoConnectionCheckUponAccept

      protected boolean shouldDoConnectionCheckUponAccept()
      Checks if an optional connection check via AFSocket.checkConnectionClosed(), is to be run upon AFServerSocket.accept(). Override to enable.
      Returns:
      true if enabled; default is false = disabled.

    • getLinuxMajorMinorVersion

      protected int[] getLinuxMajorMinorVersion()
      Returns the Linux kernel's major and minor version as an integer array (i.e., 5.10.2 -> int[]{5,10}), or null if the running system isn't Linux or the version could not be determined.
      Returns:
      The running Linux kernels' major and minor version as an integer array, or null.
